intro: Hieracium perusianum, commonly known as the Perusian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and serrated. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, producing yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium perusianum is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
